attributes.action: Sack MPs who voted to remain and do not honour their constituents leave vote
attributes.background: Many MPs who voted to remain have ignored their constituents and still tried to force through a remain campaign, even though a majority vote has insisted on leave. We voted to leave, not with a deal or no deal, we voted to leave. These MPs are not working for a constituency, but their own gain.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament are not responsible for removing MP's from office due to their views and opinions. 

How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
